page.title: 09 FOOTPATHS - COUNTRY WALKS
page.content: {The London Borough of Bromley} has over 100 miles of public footpaths and bridleways. The Council has erected a sign at the start of almost every one of them. Local groups, such as, the {Environment Bromley} group work to keep them free of overgrowth and litter as well as erecting waymarks to guide the walker and publishing a map of all the paths and booklets of suggested walks. The area covered by this block lies at the centre of the most popular walks and many people visit the villages of Cudham and Downe each weekend to enjoy walking in the countryside and partaking in refreshments at the local pubs or village hall teas. Village teas complete with home-made cakes are popular with walkers and are often provided by local groups as part of their fund-raising activities.
